= Introduction =

[http://openvibe.inria.fr/ OpenVibe] is an open source BCI application developed by [http://www.inria.fr Inria] French National Institute for Research in Computer Science and Control. 

= Details =

It is written in C/C++. It comes with a very nice designer where you can model the flow of your EEG application.
OpenVibe's scenarios used in Adastra are located in \scenarios folder.

= Download =

This is [http://openvibe.inria.fr/?q=download OpenVibe download page].

= Additional notes =

OpenVibe supports [EmotivEPOCH Emotiv EPOC], but you will still need Emotiv's Research SDK. OpenVibe runs on Linux too, although there is no official installer.
